intro: Henslowia palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan henslowia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, compound leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the lowland forests of Palawan. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
